column1: Column definitions, controlled vocabularies, and lens numbering reference

column4: NOTES

column3: D.SA.N (e.g. 1.1.1). Domains 1–6 are substantive knowledge/practice domains. Domain 7 is the Cross-Cutting Professional Practice domain, housing competencies that apply across multiple domains simultaneously.
column4: Domain.SkillArea.Sequence. Domain 7 skill areas: 7.1 = Professional Ethics Architecture; 7.2 = Human-AI Professional Practice. Code transition note: prior working documents use informal X.1–X.4 notation for ethical competencies; these map to 7.1.1–7.1.4.
FC=Fieldcraft, DC=Datacraft, SC=Statecraft. Irreducibility test governs.
Blank = no secondary warranted; not a gap.
S1=Planning, S2=Env Review, S3=Permitting, S4=Field Ops, S5=Monitoring, S6=AM&L
Count of reform sensitivity codes carried by this competency
Six reform codes: NEPA Timeline, Digital Permitting, CatEx Scope, Consultation, OFD, S2-S3 Boundary

Stable=No reform flags AND no Ac/S tasks AND not Emergent. Transition=1+ reform flag OR 1+ Ac/S task. Emergent=New professional territory (AI-enhanced, convergent robotics). REVISED LOGIC (Feb 2026): Ac tasks now trigger Transition regardless of reform flags.
Zero-core clusters: 3.1-3.3, 3.5, 4.4, 5.5. Universal but invisible in family-filtered views.
No profession family assigns this competency Core. See Foundational Prep flag.
Core=regularly required across profession. Supporting=used by some practitioners.
CANONICAL NUMBERING (Task 7 framework document). E=Explicit, I=Implicit, A=Absent. Pending population from Task 12a data.

CANONICAL L2 = Cultural Rights (FPIC, data sovereignty, Indigenous governance). NOTE: Working documents from Tasks 12a-12b used transposed numbering (L2=Transparency, L3=Cultural Rights). Database uses canonical numbering throughout.
CANONICAL L3 = Transparency & Accountability. See L2 note above re transposition correction.
Authorization, reversibility, historical precedent triggers.
Obligations when institutional pressures conflict with public/ecological duties.
High=near 1:1 SOC alignment. Low=fragmented or undercounted in BLS data. Low does not indicate taxonomy problem.

column1: The ethical lens framework document (Task 7 output, ethical_lens_framework.md) defines lenses in this order:
Task 12a-12b working documents used transposed numbering (L2/L3 swapped).
This database uses canonical (Task 7) numbering throughout. When populating L1-L5 columns
from Task 12a working documents, swap L2 and L3 values accordingly.
The Task 10 working record domain summaries under-counted reform flags.
Database uses per-competency entries (the stated source of truth), not summary statistics.

column4: Difference

column1: 57% of all competencies carry at least one reform sensitivity flag (stronger workforce signal than previously reported).
TASK 13: AI/ROBOTICS EXPOSURE CLASSIFICATION COLUMNS (added Feb 2026)

column4: Automation type for task x. A=Augmentation, Ac=Compressive Augmentation, H=Human-Essential, S=Substitution, V=Supervision
Tacit knowledge density for task x
Career ladder position. P=Primary Learning (0-5yr), C=Contributing (3-8yr), X=Peripheral/Specialist (8+yr)
Automation vector. AI=Artificial Intelligence, Ro=Physical Robotics, Cv=Convergent (both), —=None (H only)
Time horizon. 1=Deployed now, 2=3-5 years, 3=5-10+ years, N=Human-Essential (no automation trajectory)
Career Ladder Destruction flag: TRUE if any P-position Ac/S/V task exists for this competency
Documents how T13 classifications were derived. Session-direct=classified live in session. Reconstructed=derived post-hoc from working record documents.

Career Ladder Destruction severity gradient. High=primary learning mechanism substantially eliminated. Moderate=developmental value meaningfully compressed; review-and-certify function partially survives. Low=administrative overhead automated; developmental content was incidental. Blank=CLD Flag FALSE. Assigned per Standing Rule R9.
S-trajectory Delphi flag: TRUE if Ac task has documented trajectory toward full Substitution

Ratified February 2026. Cross-cutting competencies use standard D.SA.N coding under Domain 7. GitBook display name: "Cross-Cutting Professional Practice." No Python export exception handling required.

Four competencies: 7.1.1 Indigenous Data Sovereignty and Governance; 7.1.2 Intervention Authorization and Ecological Precaution; 7.1.3 Regulatory Professional Integrity; 7.1.4 AI Governance in Environmental Decision-Support.
3–5 competencies addressing human-AI teaming as professional capacity, distinct from technical AI use (Domain 2.6). Codes: 7.2.1–7.2.5. Drafting pending Task 14 Part B.
Max 5 competencies per skill area. All cross-cutting competencies housed in Domain 7 regardless of primary craft assignment.
